trigger: The regulation of HIV by retinoic acid correlates with cellular expression of the retinoic acid receptors .
The regulation of HIV by retinoic acid correlates with cellular expression of the retinoic acid receptors .
OBJECTIVES : To analyze the effect of retinoic acids ( RA ) on HIV-1 expression and correlate this effect with expression levels of RA receptors ( RARs ) in T-lymphoid and monocytoid cell lines .
OBJECTIVES : To analyze the effect of retinoic acids ( RA ) on HIV-1 expression and correlate this effect with expression levels of RA receptors ( RARs ) in T-lymphoid and monocytoid cell lines .
DESIGN AND METHODS : The effect of all-trans and 9-cis RA on HIV-1 production in T-lymphoid ( H9 , CEM ) and monocytoid ( U937 , THP-1 ) cell lines was measured during acute and chronic infection .

trigger: RESULTS : Both all-trans and 9-cis RA inhibited virus replication in HIV-1 IIIB-infected monocytoid cells , in the presence and absence of the co-stimulatory agent phorbol myristate acetate ( PMA ) .
RESULTS : Both all-trans and 9-cis RA inhibited virus replication in HIV-1 IIIB-infected monocytoid cells , in the presence and absence of the co-stimulatory agent phorbol myristate acetate ( PMA ) .
The retinoids had weak or no stimulatory effects on HIV production by T-cell lines .

The 9-cis RA was generally more effective than all-trans RA in inhibiting HIV production and in combination generally more effective than the single agents alone .

trigger: CONCLUSION : The effect of RA on HIV-1 expression was cell-type - dependent and partially correlated with cellular expression of RARs .

Endogenous or exogenously administered RA may have a significant role in HIV regulation .
